org.apache.hadoop.hive.llap

Class LlapBaseInputFormat<V extends org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.hive.llap.LlapBaseInputFormat<V>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputFormat<org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable,V>

    public class LlapBaseInputFormat<V extends org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable<?>>
extends Object
implements org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputFormat<org.apache.hadoop.io.NullWritable,V>
    Base LLAP input format to handle requesting of splits and communication with LLAP daemon.

      org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputSplit[] getSplits(org.apache.hadoop.mapred.JobConf job, int numSplits)
      Calling getSplits() will open a HiveServer2 connection which should be closed by the calling application using LlapBaseInputFormat.close() when the application is done with the splits.

        public org.apache.hadoop.mapred.InputSplit[] getSplits(org.apache.hadoop.mapred.JobConf job,
                                                       int numSplits)
                                                throws IOException
        Calling getSplits() will open a HiveServer2 connection which should be closed by the calling application using LlapBaseInputFormat.close() when the application is done with the splits.
        Specified by:

        Throws:

      • close

        public static void close(String handleId)
                  throws IOException
        Close the connection associated with the handle ID, if getSplits() was configured with a handle ID. Call when the application is done using the splits generated by getSplits().
        Parameters:
        handleId - Handle ID used in configuration for getSplits()
        Throws:
        IOException

      • closeAll

        public static void closeAll()
        Close all outstanding connections created by getSplits() calls
